issue.title: getaddrmaninfo RPC: add Transport v1/v2 to `tried` for ipv4 & ipv6
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

Would be nice if the transport version is added to `getaddrmaninfo` RPC for ipv4 and ipv6, so the user can see how many Transport v1/v2 one's node has connected to.
current:

`getaddrmaninfo`

{
  "ipv4": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x,
    "total": x
  },
  "ipv6": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x,
    "total": x
  },
  "onion": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x,
    "total": x
...

### Expected behaviour

`getaddrmaninfo`

{
  "ipv4": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x, {
      "transportv1": x,
      "transportv2": x, }
    "total": x
  },
  "ipv6": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x, {
      "transportv1": x,
      "transportv2": x, }
    "total": x
  },
  "onion": {
    "new": x,
    "tried": x,
    "total": x
...

or something like this

### Steps to reproduce

.

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

v26.0.rc2

### Operating system and version
